website_summaries.verdict: Versatile for most dogs with flavor and nutrients the brand is renown for – the best deal available from Taste of the Wild.
pros: Offers Taste of the Wild's superior grain-free formula in a versatile formula for adult dogs
Its ingredients include sweet potato and fowl and are high in nutrients, and the flavor is satisfying to most dogs
cons: Some reports of digestive upset in dogs new to the food
Some owners felt that the formula of recent batches had changed (after their dogs stopped eating it)

customer_reviews.title: Literally tried every food the vets recommended. Finally I came across Taste of the Wild ...
customer_reviews.text: My 90lb German Shepherd has seen 4 different vets and has cost thousands of dollars in tests to try to find out what shes allergic to. She was uncontrollably itchy and had hot spots everywhere. Literally tried every food the vets recommended. Finally I came across Taste of the Wild and even though its expensive, its by far the best food my shepherd has ever eaten. She is 80% better and only gets itchy once in a while. Also the fact that I can switch between flavors is amazing. She gets excited every time we have a new flavor. I would highly recommend this food to anyone that has a dog with allergies.
customer_reviews.author: PMR

customer_reviews.title: Food caused poisoning and violent diarrhea.
customer_reviews.text: Dog got very bad food poisoning from this food. She had been eating this brand for years before, but this particular bag brought it badly. It took awhile to figure out it was the food. For awhile, she didn't want to eat the food, had weird drool, and loose poops. We replaced it with ground meat and rice. Stools were fine and she was happy to eat. When we switched back to the kibble, there was immediate and violent diarrhea. Immediately switched to a different brand of food (Zignature). Stools immediately fine. Drool gone. Happy dog. Do not buy this food. Do not buy it from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Greyt Owner

customer_reviews.title: Making dogs sick across the country! Look it up!
customer_reviews.text: We have been feeding Taste of the Wild dog food to our two large dogs for several years now. However, since mid June our English Mastiff has been suffering from vomiting and diarrhea. We have eliminated everything from her diet, and just started switching her food yesterday to see if that was the issue. Then later today my husband went to the feed store to get food for the rabbit, and asked about the dog food. We were told that this brand has been having the same complaints for months. I did a search and it there are complaints everywhere with the dogs all having the same symptoms. We are switching today.
customer_reviews.author: J. Welchman

customer_reviews.title: Dogs got sick, I do NOT recommend
customer_reviews.text: I will not be buying this product again, I’ve tried several flavors, my German Shepherds kept getting sick or welts on their backs, will NEVER buy again & do NOT recommend. The dogs hated it too, refused it a lot! And it was hard, like stale, every time I purchased it (a variety of flavors too) for several months. We switched to Natural Balance & they are doing so much better & like it too! I do NOT recommend this dog food. I am a Verified Amazon Customer. And I am in no way affiliated to Natural Balamce products.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My 3 dogs various digestion/poop problems all cleared up since I put them on this "grain free" dog chow. All Taste of the Wild dog food is grain free so you can't go wrong with whatever flavor you pick. Plus, they eat less and the quantity and composition of their poop has changed: less poop and solid feces. Sounds gross, I know, but when you have to clean up after 3 dogs.....this is a big plus! Dogs don't need grain in their food......it's just filler to bulk up the weight and has no benefit for you dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Recent changes of this specific flavor and brand.  Size and shape change of the pellet.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this food for my two dogs, they both have been eating this same exact food for a year(the golden a year, the coonhound 1 month). As of recent both dogs have become very ill and we had to take my 6month old dog to the vet last night for severe dehydration. Both dogs have had diharrea since we have been feeding them this new bag. And both recently stopped eating this food all together. I fear there may be something wrong with this batch. Even the pellet size and shape has changed from previous bags. We will not be ordering this brand and type any longer. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Nonsensical Unicorn

customer_reviews.title: I switched to anther food and he's eating like normal and his energy level has returned
customer_reviews.text: My GSD has been on TOTW for over a year but the past two bags have left him with diarrhea and lack of energy. He's very food motivated and The only way he would eat it is if I added pumpkin to it. I contacted TOTW and was sent a very generic response with no helpful information. Reading the other reviews makes me wonder why they won't investigate a potential QC issue. I switched to anther food and he's eating like normal and his energy level has returned. I suggest you stop using this product if you see these symptoms as it could lead to large vet bills.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Gourmet doggy dinner that is Oh So Healthy
customer_reviews.text: MMMmmmmm, yuummmmmm. My dog eats this stuff up! Really though, my spouse is a very conscientious product researcher and dog mommy and this is what she said we should feed our dog. It's nutritious, ooooh yeah. I like that it comes in a handful of different flavors so I can mix it up a bit for Fido without worrying about her getting an upset belly from eating a different brand / formulation. I'm pretty sure you could spend more money on dog food but you wouldn't be getting much more I imagine, this is good healthy stuff for your best furry friend. Oh yeah, my dog really does like it a lot too.
customer_reviews.author: HowdagerTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: 3 out of 3 dogs prefer
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs: small (doxy), medium (Aussie), large (Pyrenees). Our first choice is TOTW! They do very well on this and we find that grain-free means they eat less and digest better which results in less scooping. It is not an extravagance to feed higher quality dog food when they consume less to get the required nutrients. It's interesting that we can usually order the big bag delivered to our door cheaper than buying locally and paying tax on it...so we do. Highly recommended for premium dog food without breaking the budget!
customer_reviews.author: Jett

customer_reviews.title: Great long term dog food
customer_reviews.text: I’ve fed my dog Taste of the Wild for the past decade, since she started on adult dog food. I have had a few “bag bags” over the years that she has gotten sick from, refused to eat, etc. (and bad bags purchased from Amazon have always been refunded or replaced with no hassle). Overall, I attribute my husky’s good health to this high quality food. People are shocked when I tell her she is 10, usually asking “you means 10 months?” I am a believer in ToTW and switch up the flavor every few months to give her some variety.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, convenient to order online
customer_reviews.text: I usually give my 2.5 year old border collie mix the salmon version of TOTW, but lately her fishy breath was getting got be too much to bear. I switched her to this, and she absolutely loves it. Same energy, same soft shiny coat, same solid poops she's had since we switched her as a puppy. I will continue to feed TOTW to her and any other pets we get in the future. (they also make cat food which is apparently just as good) I love how its so easy to have it delivered to the door vs having to drive to tractor supply and pick it up at the exact same price. Love the convenience!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredients but makes my dog gassy!
customer_reviews.text: I like the ingredients in this brand. before I used to feed them purina one true Instinct and my little Maltese mix would pick out all these soft bites. These are all round pellets so there is no picking for her to do which is awesome. The only downside is that my French Bulldog gets extremely gassy eating this brand
customer_reviews.author: E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this
customer_reviews.text: Any Taste of the Wild dry dog food makes my dogs happy. I rotate flavors. One of my dogs figured out how to open the container with the dog food and stuffed herself. No eating problems whatsoever. Their coats look good, they are in good health, no food allergies. Will keep buying it. Glad there's more than one flavor for my furry family.
customer_reviews.author: In Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on dog foods 3 years ago before we got our Lab. Ingredients out high quality and has everything she needs. She loves this food and the different flavors. It’s so convenient to have it delivered. Definitely recommend. Let me know if this review was helpful!
customer_reviews.author: VLBURKE

customer_reviews.title: Upset Tummies
customer_reviews.text: I've had my dogs on Avoderm grain free for awhile now and they were doing great on it but I decided to try and give them something new and exciting. (I know, silly) They didn't have any horrible reactions and they loved the taste of the food but they had really bad gas after the switch, both from the back end and through burps. I have a Frenchie and a Boston so dog farts aren't rare or anything, but they were extra pungent, frequent and I could hear the belly grumbles. I switched back to their old food before this bag was even half gone.
customer_reviews.author: Tera Ashley

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 Will buy forever
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying Taste of the Wild for our Patterdale Terrier since she was about 2 years old. We discovered she had many food allergies and would get terrible sores from itching so badly. This was a miracle in a bag for her. Good, reliable food that's not full of gross fillers, it doesn't break the bank, and it doesnt have any allergens for her. 10/10 will buy for every canine family member we have. Also, she is small at 22lbs, has 2/3c a day and the 30lb bag lasts us about 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this food over and over and over again to ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have been eating this dog food almost their entire lives. I used to purchase it though a local pet store, but my husband is in the military and we are now living overseas. I didn't want to have to switch my dogs food, so when I found out that I could purchase it through Amazon I was thrilled. I also order the Taste of the Wild Puppy food for my 9 month old puppy and she absolutely loves that as well. It's a high quality pet food at a much lower price point than similar quality pet food. I recommend this food over and over and over again to people I know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Border collies favorite
customer_reviews.text: Dog food is tricky in my opinion, many people have their own experiences and thoughts on certain brands, ingredients, etc. All I can say is I used to feed my border collie Blue Buffalo until they had a recall, and switched to Taste of the Wild as a high protein grain free option. My BC loves all the different flavors, I rotate them frequently. Stool has no texture issues. At such an affordable cost, given I'm a graduate student, I'll stick with TOTW.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: we LOVE this dog food!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this dog food. We found this brand at a small local shop and my dog is definitely a fan. There are a lot of different flavors and we switch it up every month to keep her interested. This food does a great job of maintaining a good weight with her; she gets the recommended amount of food for her size and she is a fairly active dog so she has stayed a constant weight for two years on this food. I plan to keep buying this food for her because we like it so much! (It is also a bonus for how much you get and the cost for it considering how healthy the food is)
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: High quality, affordable price
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I switched our dog's food from Beneful to Taste of the Wild due to some skin irritation my dog was experiencing. After doing some research, we decided to give Taste of the Wild a try. My dog's hot spots quickly went away, and she is a whole lot happier with this food. It's a high quality recipe for an affordable price. It's definitely worth the switch from "value" brands like Beneful and IAMS.
customer_reviews.author: J. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: My aussie wasn't a fan at all
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for my aussie to try this food, but he didnt care for it at all! Also, I'm not sure if every bag is like this but it was very crumbly? As if someone had taken a whole bag of crumbs from the bottom of the bag and dumped them in with the food. It was a very odd texture. Maybe it just wasnt for him though!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Causes Horrible Smelling Poop and Gas
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned in other reviews, this food causes toxic gas in dogs. Both of my four month old German Shepherd's have had the most foul smelling poop and gas ever since we started feeding them this food. And now both of them are starting to smell like a rancid Christmas tree despite being bathed yesterday. Stopping this food immediately and throwing the rest away.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: The perfect dog food for my beagle mutt
customer_reviews.text: This is my dog's favorite food. I've found that he gets tired of the other flavors of this food, but he's always excited for Wild Fowl. We were also worried the other flavors upset his tummy sometimes. His coat is nice and shiny, his teeth stay clean (with brushings of course!) and he's not allergic. When we originally switched to this from the Vet's brand, he went from not really caring about his food to being REALLY excited. No gas, no weird poop, no smelly breath.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Highest quality for my best friends
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this food due to its high rating on dog food adviser. This food does not have unnecessary additives or a large amount of filler like other popular brands. Having miniature schnauzers, food quality and consistency is important. I will never feed them any food but Taste of the Wild.
customer_reviews.author: Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Dogs voted and selection remains...
customer_reviews.text: Used to work for a company that manufactured dog food. Wilson Foods. They used hog hair to increase the protein! Luckily for our canines (and humans) that company didn't survive. This is great dog food with excellent quality marks so far. Will continue until I see something better or a negative trend. Have been using several years at an above average expense. I asked all 3 dogs if they wanted to go to Purina & nearly had a revolt on my hands. All give a positive nod to Taste of the Wild. Have been buying locally but this price is better by about $10 with better selection & delivery to my door.
customer_reviews.author: DWD

customer_reviews.title: Good compromise of quality, price, and size
customer_reviews.text: I used to feed our my Trader Joe's Premium Dog Food, but that product was discontinued. I tried Blue Buffalo and he responded well, but BB was a bit out of my budget, so I tried Taste of the Wild. The dog likes this and his coat is shinier and he smells better than he did when he was eating the TJ's food. This fits my budget much better. For reference, my dog is about 40 lbs and he eat 1 cup of food 2x per day. One of these bags lasts about 3 months. Recommended if you want a high quality food for your dog but can't swing paying $30 for a small bag of Blue Buffalo.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Phillips

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: For some reason dog has bad stomach reaction.We do bay wetlands,salmon,lamb. It is first time stomach problem...
customer_reviews.author: vera chumakina

customer_reviews.title: but I think this is the one that they like the best
customer_reviews.text: I've tried almost every flavor of TotW for my pets, but I think this is the one that they like the best. The second is Hi Prairie, and we regularly rotate the two. Both my Malamute and ChowChow gulp them down without hesitation, and the Chow is horrendously picky about what she's willing to put in her face. (They also loved the fish-based one, but that gave them really smelly poops. So that's something to consider). I HAVE noticed that, sometimes, the bits seem to vary from puppy-sized to adult-sized with each bag; it doesn't seem to upset their stomachs or anything, so I'll assume that it's all still the same and goes through a different machine or something.
customer_reviews.author: Shik

customer_reviews.title: The best dog food
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was severely underweight when we adopted her. The shelter gave us nature's balance and she gained weight, but also had to go to potty frequently. Thought it was a bit strange. We did our research and found that Taste of the Wild by all sources was rated an absolutely perfect score. Our dog loves her food and her bowel movements have become regular. We see a difference in her coat and she has gained weight but is not overweight. I love buying this product with confidence and know I am giving her the absolute best food. If you love your dog and want to give her the best, it is a little pricier, but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs, a shih tzu, a chiweenie and a weimaraner. Very different breeds, and all three had problems with commercial brand dog foods, including diarrhea, vomiting, and hives. We did raw food for a while, but that's not practical when we travel or go camping frequently. Have tried several brands of grain free with good results. Taste of the Wild is priced well and my shih tzu, who is severely allergic to grains, has not had hives since we switched him to this brand. This one is their favorite, the salmon...not so much. As long as they keep making it the same way, we'll keep buying it. And thanks Amazon for the good price and free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: ... allergic reactions to it - so that is a great thing! He loves the taste and we love ...
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old American Pitbull's digestive system has agreed to this food and we haven't had any skin issues or any other allergic reactions to it - so that is a great thing! He loves the taste and we love the apparently wholesome quality ingredients and flavor options that Taste of the Wild comes in - we have tried 3 flavors so far. It is a more affordable dog food brand compared to other high quality foods with a similar ingredient formula. Cheaper for us to get it through Amazon than at our local expensive pet store. However, I do wish it was a few dollars cheaper or went on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Olya

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food. Recommended to us by our vet, its a great price and perfect size pieces. Also good quality ingredients and lots of flavor varieties. Also, monthly dog food delivery is a heaven sent.... getting to the store to buy a 40lb bag of food each month is annoying and sometimes hard for me to carry through the store. Not to mention the discount if you enroll in auto ship!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Taste of the Wild dry dog food
customer_reviews.text: I love this dog food. I have a malamute that gets extremely sick when he eats grain, so I switched to this brand. Very happy with the product.. I did a lot of research and found this brand to rate better than Blue Buffalo and all the others. Started feeding it to my other two dogs. It has slowed down the little bumps (fat deposits) that were growing on my lab. Dogs seem to be much healthier. I order this through Amazon so it is delivered to my door step. That way I don't have to carry the heavy bag from the store...plus it is cheaper. I've tried all the other flavors, but this is my dogs favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah B.

customer_reviews.title: Great For Bully Breeds: High Protein and Grain Free
customer_reviews.text: I have done a significant amount of research on what food brands truly offer the best for our pitbull. This food has outperformed my favorite brand, Blue Buffalo: Lamb with brown rice. Pros- My dog loves this food and his coat it very shiny. It’s truly grain free and the cost is very affordable! Cons- It’s not GMO Free or organic but I understand that if it were, it would cost a great deal more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Goodin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality grain free dog food for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I have two belgian malinois and they love this food. I rotated the protein with high praire for mantain there enthusiasm with the food. Also I mixed both package in a bulk for more taste. There coat is beatifull and the people always ask me what I feed to my dogs. Amazon price is a great deal and this is very important for me because I have two working dogs. I tried some brands with bad results and a waste of money. Also I feed raw food but is was very expensive and take to much time at the kitchen. I recommended this food for any dog. Remember to do the proper food transition and your dog will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: MaryyGabyyGE

customer_reviews.title: Very good dog food.
customer_reviews.text: This is what I feed my dogs. Every once in a while I do tons of internet reading, and comparing ingredients, price, and reviews of experts. This is the greatest, cost effective food that is out there. Some other brands are similar in health but much more expensive. My dogs love it. They eat it for two meals a day, and still I can use the dog food as treats. Their fur fur is soft and shiny and the are very alert, playful dogs. And my dogs have healthy digestion and poops that hold their shape (not runny poops) and not constipating either.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. H.

customer_reviews.title: Now my dog has pancreatitis....
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my 2 dogs this food for over a year and one of them in particular had diarrhea here and there. Recently, the occurrences started picking up steam. Last night, he threw up 7 times until all he had left was bile. My other dog has diarrhea. Today he was diagnosed with pancreatitis. We are never feeding them this food again - or our cats! We never feed the dogs cheese or fatty foods, and of course I just did a little research and saw how many other people are having issues with this food. Especially recently.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Lintini

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this food, i am still on the fence
customer_reviews.text: Previously my dog had many issues with grains in her food, this does not have grains and doesnt cost an arm and a leg. Only drawback is this gives her the raunchiest farts but I guess I can live with that as long as she's happy and healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Healthy food for my GSD
customer_reviews.text: I used to feed my GSD Blue Buffalo and it is a great dog food but she did not like the different kernels. I switched her to Taste of the Wild and she absolutely loves it. I know that this is really healthy dog food for my GSD. I will only ever buy the best dog food for my dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Firegal

customer_reviews.title: Great grain free option
customer_reviews.text: The Taste of the Wild foods are about the only ones that my rescue dog can handle. He has to have grain free food because he had worms and malnutrition prior to rescue and they did a number on his digestive tract. This food seems to be easy for him to digest and it helps him keep his weight up. He is very active and the food seems to keep him healthy and full of energy. His coat is also beautiful and seemed more dull when he ate Blue Buffalo. I think this food is very good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: hitthewall55

customer_reviews.title: dog loves
customer_reviews.text: we have a lab that has a wheat allergy. made our own food in the past for him but that becomes a huge task. we started purchasing Taste of the Wild dog food. this is our 3rd bag now. he didn't care for the salmon too much. seems to enjoy this one quite well. doesn't scratch as much. has a shinier coat. patchy spots on coat from allergies have grown back. with so many horror stories with different food and treats its a relieve to find one that i trust. we had also looked at blue buffalo but i believe this to be a superior product. great price for the dog food.
customer_reviews.author: RMW

customer_reviews.title: Our Dogs Are Always Healthy With Taste Of The Wild
customer_reviews.text: The most important issue when it comes to dog food is the health of your dog. We have 2 small 7 year old chihuahua mixes and they've been eating Taste of the Wild Wetlands dog food for 5+ years. They both love the food, look forward to mealtime and have not experienced any health issues. From time to time we try giving our girls a little variety, but that only results in upset tummies. Sticking with Taste of the Wild keeps them both looking good and feeling good.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: I discovered Taste of the Wild maybe 18 months ago ...
customer_reviews.text: I discovered Taste of the Wild maybe 18 months ago while looking for a grain-free dog food. I will never, ever purchase a different brand again. Within two weeks of the first bag I saw a marked improvement in my Lab and Pomeranian. From coat to bowels, my 10+ year old dogs became puppies again. And they are NUTTY for the Wildfowl, but will empty their dishes post haste of every meat except Salmon.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good dog food
customer_reviews.text: Our dachshund seems to really enjoy it. This dog food came highly recommended from the adoption animal shelter. Love that I order online and have it delivered to my door.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Duchess Anna

customer_reviews.title: Yay, no more vomiting!
customer_reviews.text: I had my Brittany on Nutra nuggets, which is a quality lamb and rice food. She threw up somewhat regularly but we thought she was eating grass or getting into something. I moved to a different state and couldn't get the same food where I shop, so I thoroughly researched dog food to find the best one for a fair price. The ingredients of taste of the wild are superior to what she was eating. She loves it and doesnt vomit anymore!! No more nasty cleanups for me. Life's so much better with small improvements like this.
customer_reviews.author: Alexasmaster

customer_reviews.title: This is a great, high quality product
customer_reviews.text: My dogs (a Chow mix and a Chihuahua) both really like this dog food which is great in itself. However, what I like most about it is the quality of the ingredients - all natural, no fillers, no by-products, well-balanced, vitamin enhanced and, really important, made in the USA not China. Taste of the Wild is always rated among the top dog foods and while it's more expensive than the big name junk that can be bought at the grocery store, quality simply costs more, but it's well worth it to ensure my pets have a healthy diet and are eating the best food I can provide for them.
customer_reviews.author: ocalaflorida

customer_reviews.title: Satisfies my XL dogs
customer_reviews.text: Much better than another grain-free brand I've purchased through Amazon before. The protein content is much higher by almost 10%. i've noticed it satisfies my two XL dogs much more, esp. the male, my St. Bernard. I rescued him as a stray from humane society and the guy was malnourished. Although still very food motivated even after a year of having him, the higher protein diet seems to satisfy him and settle him down more after eating. And his cow ear chews also help too! Another surprise positive side effect was that it took away my Newf's ear itchiness and stinky ear wax secretions! Thanks, TofW...please don't change your formula or quality ingredients!
customer_reviews.author: Papfabs

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Dogs like it - if this isn't too graphic, the volume of my two mid-sized dogs fecal production reduced noticeably after we move to this brand. I am no scientist, but this suggests to me that it has less "fillers" or unnecessary stuff in it.
customer_reviews.author: P. B.

customer_reviews.title: I only feed my dogs taste of the wild
customer_reviews.text: I only feed my dogs taste of the wild. They love it and it’s so healthy. It’s super healthy for them and not insanely expensive.
customer_reviews.author: cheers

customer_reviews.title: Good dog feed, price is decent
customer_reviews.text: Had good luck with this brand. Food seems to be of quality composition. My dog, a german shepard mix, likes it and shows no signs of digestion issues. Some other grain based foods caused doggy dandruff, but this corrected that issue. Its worth the coin if you want a solid dog feed. Price is about as competative as I've seen for this level.
customer_reviews.author: bummers

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Loved the Taste, But Man Did They Have Gas!
customer_reviews.text: While my dogs love the taste of this food, it really gave them loose stools and bad gas even after multiple bags. I tried adding pumpkin to it but that didn’t change anything. I finally changed brands.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Thiel

customer_reviews.title: - She's happier - More Energetic - Strains less when she poops ...
customer_reviews.text: Luna this food for the higher fiber content. Pros: - She's happier - More Energetic - Strains less when she poops - No more random puking - No eating grass. Cons: - Massive poops (barely fit in one baggie - she's a medium size dog and now poops like a Great Dane) - Noxious nonchalant farts - not even a little bit of guilt displayed.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Camilo

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this stuff, and no longer has gas!!
customer_reviews.text: When we first got our dog, he had terrible, smelly gas. I did some research and read that a grain free diet might help. We switched him to Taste of the Wild because it is high quality yet comparably priced to store bought brands. He no longer has gas and his coat is shiny and healthy. And he has tons of energy (but that's probably just his nature). As with any food change, go slow and mix the old and new for a while. I am glad that Amazon carries this brand!! We also prefer the Wetlands formula - we tried the bison one but he still had a little gas with that one.
customer_reviews.author: OzarkGal

customer_reviews.title: bag of dog food arrived opened and food spilled inside the delivery box
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying it for months without incidents. My most recent order arrived yesterday. The delivery box was in perfect condition; however, the 30 lb bag of dog food inside was open and a couple pounds of dog food spilled out inside the box. It is going to the garbage because now I am self conscious and very afraid of feeding my dog from a bag that has been previously opened. US50.00 in the trash. :(
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: This bag I just purchased I believe is bad. They started throwing up so I have ceased ...
customer_reviews.text: Trying to figure out how I get in touch with he company. I have used this dog food for a couple of years with no problems. This bag I just purchased I believe is bad. They started throwing up so I have ceased giving it to them. What can be done? I can't seem to find how to contact you all.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Gregg-Montella

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food
customer_reviews.text: I admittedly was a little scared going back to this company after the big salmonella scare killed several dogs and made lots of people sick. However, the price and quality of the ingredients in this food makes this worth it to me. I have tried several of the flavors of Taste of the Wild and my dog seems to like the wetlands formula the best. Amazon also beats the best local price I can find on this stuff. My lab's coat looks great and her bathroom habits have been fine on it. As long as the company keeps up health standards, this is a fantastic food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Review Dude

customer_reviews.title: Once again, great product from "Taste of Wild"
customer_reviews.text: My dog was eating "Taste of the Wild Dry Dog Food, Hi Prairie Canine Formula with Roasted Bison & Venison" for about a year and he loved it and never left any in the bowl. We decided to switch the flavor to the Roasted Wild Fowl. He has a hard time communicating directly to me, but I sure think he likes it better. Why? Probably cause it was a change. Once thing for sure is both formulas are well accepted by our Shetland Sheepdog (Shelty). Never had an issue an on to our 2nd year of use for our dog. Will continue to buy as we love the ingredients in these products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great food, happy healthy dogs.
customer_reviews.text: HIghly recommend this brand over anything you'll find at the grocery store, or most chain pet stores. Grain-free is a more natural diet for dogs, this is high in protein, and my dogs love it. It may cost a little more, but a quality food may save you vet bills later. And if that's not enough, a quality grain-free food is more absorbed by the dog's body, leaving a lot less at the back end, if you get my drift. There are a lot of higher-priced foods with this quality, this is one of the more readily available and comparatively reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Angela62

customer_reviews.title: but they love this food and it has good ingredients
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are picky eaters, but they love this food and it has good ingredients. There is some food I would never feed my dogs, but Taste of the Wild is very good. I would recommend it, the size is more on the medium size and it's flatter, easier for Med to Small dogs to chew but would also be perfect for larger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this and his output is so regular
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food. I love that it's made in the US by a family owned company, has real food and not fillers, and probiotics. The dog transitioned easily from Royal Canin. The price is comparable and the quality is better. A friend recommended it and now I have recommended it to many friends. I got the poultry one.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Even our picky chihuahua will eat it.
customer_reviews.text: With 4 dogs, I am constantly looking for cheap but healthy food for them. We had been feeding them Blue Buffalo Wilderness because I feel strongly about grain-free diets. I had always been aware of Taste of the Wild but assumed since is was a better quality of food, it was more expensive. I found out it was actually significantly cheaper than Blue Buffalo. We have a really picky Chihuahua who would pick at the Blue Buffalo and now eats this just fine. I would highly recommend this food if you are looking for something that is high quality but middle of the road in price.
customer_reviews.author: Jane's Place

customer_reviews.title: Been feeding our dogs this their entire lives.
customer_reviews.text: I have read some reviews about bad batches of this food. Not sure what to make of them. We have been feeding our 3 dogs this food for 10 years without a single issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Huge German Shepherd Prefers this to other Grain Free Top Brands.
customer_reviews.text: My 115# German Shepherd loves this food! He has a routine stool once a day that is solid. (sorry if too much info for some) At this time he chooses this food over blue buffalo and has for months. I tried it after seeing the ingredients. I feel I am feeding him a food he loves with the best nutrition for him! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Lesia Richardson

customer_reviews.title: A+ from my dog and I
customer_reviews.text: Switched to this food from Merrick Grain Free duck and sweet potato when the price went up almost 10$ in 7 months. This food is great! My dog, 30 pound terror-basenji mutt, loves it and she chews her food more than she did the other food, I think because the pieces are a bit larger. I also give her a bit more since it seems not as filling or just measures differently with bigger pieces. Also her stools have been consistently firm since switching to this food which is a big plus. Only the 2nd type of dog food I have bought but its my favorite of the two.
customer_reviews.author: M. VanBergen

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Likes It
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to like it and he's tolerated it well. We're down to the bottom of the bag, with no problems. He's a ten year old, healthy, lively, Dalmatian mix. I did a lot of research before I ordered this. Among the highly rated dog foods, it was the least expensive. I found comments suggesting product safety concerns, but I found similar complaints for every dog food on the market so they didn't factor into my decision.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Do not order from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered this food from Amazon twice. The first bag was great and my dog loved it, but when we got the second bag he was always hesitant to eat it and he began vomiting quite often. We switched to a different brand and his issues have resolved, so I'm pretty sure we got a bad bag of food. I still think it's a good, high quality dog food, but I would avoid getting it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delicious! I tried it myself! jk
customer_reviews.text: Great Dog food, I've been feeding my dogs this brand for a few years now. I recently moved and couldn't find a pet store that carried it and was happy to find that Amazon had it. The first order worked well, but the most recent one must have been stolen from my doorstep. So, if you are able to be around for delivery or have a safe way to receive it, go for it. If not I think it's too conspicuous to lay unattended for too long (makes me laugh to think of how excited the theives must have been to get snag such big heavy loot and then find out it's dog food! haha, I hope they enjoyed it!)
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Have ordered several times and didn't pay attention to date ...
customer_reviews.text: Have ordered several times and didn't pay attention to date on bag till i read some reviews about others dogs getting upset stomach and bag was out of date. I read reviews after my dog had repeated diarrhea and date was June 2016! Stopped feeding and no more issues. Threw the rest out and will start getting at store from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jay Granger

customer_reviews.title: This wonderful grain free formula keeps my dogs healthy and happy
customer_reviews.text: This wonderful grain free formula keeps my dogs healthy and happy. It's higher in fat, but by now everybody should know that GOOD fats are healthy! All my dogs have glossy coats and NO skin or ear problems that can be the sign of a poor diet. You can be assured that you are feeding your dogs real food and not feather filler or something worse. I've been feeding Taste of the Wild for several years.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kresa

customer_reviews.title: Great for allergy prone dog
customer_reviews.text: Or at least what seemed like allergies. Been feeding this to our 10 year old pit bull for over a year now after she was having what appeared to be some allergy issues (according to the vet) to her old food. After trying other chicken, beef, and fish based foods from other brands like Blue Buffalo and Solid Gold, we gave this one a shot since duck is supposed to help. She takes some meds, so we also switched her Greenies pill pockets to duck too. No problems since. She eats it up and getting dog food via Amazon with free shipping is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: My dog would never eat much
customer_reviews.text: Heard about dogs getting sick from amazon dog food, switched brands and stores and my dog is eating a lot more. Don't know if it was amazon or the brand, don't really care. I'll pay a few bucks more to avoid making my dog sick.
customer_reviews.author: Big boy

customer_reviews.title: My dogs Love this food
customer_reviews.text: My dogs Love this food! We have a 7 month Shih Tzu and a 2 year old Fiest Mix, we switched over from Purina One and they both seem to enjoy this much much more as they now lick their bowls clean (always food left over when they had were on Purina One). They seem to have more energy and are more playful. I am trying to keep my dogs healthy so they can live a long life and this seems like a step in the right direction, I would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: John Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great - i keep buying it, as does my family
customer_reviews.text: my dogs have been eating this brand for a while now. my sisters switched to it as well. I looked up the fish meal that they use and it's approved. I think it gave one of the dogs watery stool for a bit, but that dissipated, and my sister added probiotics to hers, and that works well for the dogs as well. I switch up the type but stick to this brand. My dogs have allergies, and that's why i initially switched to this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ronin Z

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE BE AWARE! MADE DOGS SICK
customer_reviews.text: I have bought taste of the wild for years now through amazon and there’s definitely something off. My dog has been vomiting, and unfortunately, I didn’t think it would be the food seeing as I’ve always given her this brand; however, I am currently dog sitting my brother’s dog and after eating a bit of it he’s now been throwing up as well. I went to buy a bag from a local pet store and she seems to be fine now. I just wish I would’ve figured it out before having to make a trip to the vet and spending an exorbitant amount of money! Buyers please be aware. I would suggest not buying through amazon anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Tapia fam

customer_reviews.title: Very good grain-free food
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs have been eating this for 3 weeks now and are doing great on it. I saw zero digestive distress as I switched to this from another food. The protein sources are impressive, and the fact that it's grain-free make it great for my overweight dog with allergy problems. She had itching problems prior to this food, but following a vet's advice I went grain-free and this problem has cleared up. She's also lost some weight, so all is going well.
customer_reviews.author: ph301

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy Siberian Husky
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say that I've tried everything there is in Premium dog foods. I've had nothing but Siberian Huskies since 1970. In that time I've raised, bred, shown and raced these guys. I had an opportunity to take on a husky rescue almost a year ago. I feed him once a day. And every day he does the happy dance the minute I start to get this food until I put it out. And he licks the bowl clean. This is a well balanced grain free food with all he'll need in the way of nutrition. Needless to say we're both very happy with Taste Of The Wild Dog Food.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Shackelford

customer_reviews.title: great dog food
customer_reviews.text: love this food for my dogs, this was a great option since we moved far away from our usual pet store. very prompt shipping/delivery, thanks for a great experience.
customer_reviews.author: DangerMouse

customer_reviews.title: Siberan Husky food of choice
customer_reviews.text: This bag of food lasts my Siberian Husky two and a half to three months she gets prance happy when the food bin comes out. These Taste of the Wild bags have been her food of choice for about four years without any serious issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: My Shiba Inu LOVED IT!
customer_reviews.text: Well all I can go by is how my Shiba Inu eat it. HE DEVOURED the portion I gave him! This is our 1st time with Taste of the Wild dog food and Max really gobbled it up! I am switching brands because from what I read Taste of the Wild is healthier for him. Thanks! Also product came fast, was sealed very well, no signs of tampering or punctures. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Simone

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality &  Dogs Love This Brand of Food
customer_reviews.text: Top quality dog food! Recommended by my veterinarian. Always ranks in the top for kibble ratings for nutrition and quality.
customer_reviews.author: jackie's

customer_reviews.title: Yum-duck!
customer_reviews.text: I picked up my dog from a rescue who recommended really expensive holistic food. She had bald spots everywhere from an unspecified cause (numbeous tests for mange, etc were negative). Since Amazon no longer delivered my previous natural brand, I decided to try TOTW. Her hair grew back, shiny coat,way, way too much energy, and sometimes she doesn't even finish right away...it's that filling. One bag lasts me a month (including my stepdog, who is there about 4-5 nights a week. The convenience of Prime is the icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: DashOneCharlie

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand from a feed store for my dog since she was itching a lot and was told that a high quality food could help. She loves this food and will push me out of the way when I am filling her bowl to get the food quicker. The itching is less but not solved. I did research and found that this brand and flavor is rated with 5 stars based on the ingredients. I am just so happy that I am able to get it delivered to my door vs running out to the store.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: But they're not picky. Kibble is a good size to put in enrichment toys. Will continue to buy.
customer_reviews.author: CamilleElise

customer_reviews.title: Great food that my dogs love to eat!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this food and it has made a tremendous difference in their skin and coat. All my dogs are rescues and have had skin and Allergy issues in the past. I switch up my flavors every few months or so but always stay with Taste of the Wild. They love the Boar and the Bison as well as this flavor. You can't go wrong with this brand and your dogs will thank you!
customer_reviews.author: DarbyKate

customer_reviews.title: Gas mask needed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this food. I've heard good things about it and about grain free diets for dogs. We tried this for a few months and while my dog loves it (I think he would eat just about anything), he had terrible gas. Because he's a rescue dog, we just thought that was the way he is. Well, we boarded him and he ate Nutrisource for a week and for a few days he had no gas. It returned after a few meals of this stuff. We will be trying Nutrisource from now on, as we love our dog but hate his nasty farts.
customer_reviews.author: A. Betzold

customer_reviews.title: Great nutrition that my dogs love.
customer_reviews.text: I have done a lot of research on dog food because I want my dogs to have the best of what I can afford. This food gets great ratings on nutritional analysis websites and my dogs gobble it down. The only complaint I have is that it is often difficult to find in the state I recently moved. I check Amazon for it often because there are sometimes amazing deals. The other day I got this food for $20 less than the cheapest place in my city.
customer_reviews.author: CAB

customer_reviews.title: I like being able to read the ingredients not see an ...
customer_reviews.text: I feed both of my dogs (a Siberian Husky & a German Shepherd) with TOTW grain-free as my Siberian Husky has allergic reactions to grain. This diet works well for both of them: they an active and healthy with extremely shiny coats. As a pet owner, I like being able to read the ingredients not see an over-abundance of empty-calorie filler byproduct! I change formulas every now and again, but they've been on the Wetlands formula for about 5 months now. I also alternate with the Pacific & High Prairie formula, which are both solid TOTW diets as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Hornes

customer_reviews.title: Dogs seem to love this dog-food and I have zero issues with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Dogs seem to love this dog-food and I have zero issues with it as it is also rated high by dog food advisor as a 4 out of 5 stars for dry dog food. The TOTW High Prairie receives 5 out of 5 and I enjoy mixing up the flavors for the dog. My only hesitancy (and not worth downgrading a star) is I discovered Diamond naturals dog food which also receives 4 out of 5 stars but I get 40 lbs for $34 instead of 30 Lbs for $46 so I have switched to Diamonds for now.
customer_reviews.author: thepak92

customer_reviews.title: This product seems to be very well balanced and healthy, but my 3 year old lab will not eat the food
customer_reviews.text: Just wish my dog would have liked it, as I did a lot of research deciding on what food to feed her. I hope others have better turn outs, I even tried putting a bit of coconut oil and then olive oil to food with still no luck.
customer_reviews.author: rrrrc

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out for my dogs with dry skin
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry to report that all three of my dogs (a Newfie, a Lab, and a Pug), each of whom has recurring problems with dry skin, started developing dry patches after a month of Taste of the Wild Wetlands formula. I add a good quality oil supplement to my dogs' food every day, but that didn't stop them from getting itchy again when I switched to this food. I'll be going back to Premium Edge seafood formula (which helps their skin AND which they love), or perhaps Canidae.
customer_reviews.author: Moody Muse

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this dog food for years now for my terrier. He loves it - I bounce around on the flavors, but you can't beat the quality, size and price of taste of the wild. Thanks for making such a great product for my fur baby!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: I have a lab and a spaniel-type dog and they both pack on weight pretty quickly, but they eat 3 cups of this ...
customer_reviews.text: Both my dogs are on this food and they're doing really well. I have a lab and a spaniel-type dog and they both pack on weight pretty quickly, but they eat 3 cups of this food a day plus treats and they stay slim. Their coats are great. I've fed raw before and I didn't see a difference in their energy level or coat quality when I switched them to taste of the wild. If you're looking to switch foods, definitely start feeding this a little at a time, mixed in with your dog's regular food to make sure the dog has no allergies and can tolerate it. Very nice food for a good price. Good quality. A+
customer_reviews.author: LSChic

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this - it must taste good and I know he is getting the nutrition he needs
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this. Our vet said he needed more protein and this certainly provided it. Amazon's price and having it delivered to my door (no struggling with getting a big bag home) were both helpful in making the decision to buy this. That and Taste of the Wild is a top quality brand. I figure feed your animals good quality food (even if it costs a little more) or end up paying vet bills from not eating nutricious food.
customer_reviews.author: Mooselady

customer_reviews.title: ONLY Food I Will Give Libby
customer_reviews.text: After doing hours upon hours of research into healthy dog food brands, I settled on this one and I couldn't be happier. The "Wildfowl" mix received a 5-star health rating from "dogfoodreviews" based on the food's natural, healthy ingredients. While it may be a bit more pricey than the other big-name brands, it's for good reason. It is like fast food vs Whole Foods. If you care about what goes in your body, you should definitely care what goes in your best friend's body!
customer_reviews.author: Casey Tripoli

customer_reviews.title: Great food, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This food is wonderful. My dogs LOVE it. I feed it to my scotty (23 pounds) and a very energetic mutt (50 pounds). It's the only food I will buy them, as it is grain free. They both act more energetic since they began eating it about 7 months ago. They both also have lost a little weight, and look healthier with better coats since the switch. Yes, taste of the wild is a little more expensive, but if you can afford it, your dogs will love it. There are several flavors, try them out and see which ones your dogs like.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Laxton

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food!
customer_reviews.text: I love TOTW dog food! This particular formula (Wetlands with Roasted Fowl) has excellent independent reviews. I've been feeding this particular brand and formula to my 7 year-old pit bull mix for the past four years. His weight is always excellent, he has plenty of energy, and his coat and teeth are very healthy. The pebbles are a good size for small or large breed dogs.
customer_reviews.author: alecsgirl

customer_reviews.title: High quality does your dog right
customer_reviews.text: This food agrees with my dog. I know everyone's mileage will vary with that, but my household really likes it. This 30 lb bag will last my 25 lb mutt right about 3 months, and with the great price here on Amazon, that's less than $15/month on dog food. For that, I'm very happy to be able to buy my dog food with quality ingredients. I'd highly recommend Taste of the Wild to anyone looking to go grain free, or try a higher quality food for their dog.
customer_reviews.author: J. Freyberg

customer_reviews.title: Best We have Found for the Money
customer_reviews.text: We all want the best food for our dogs, and we all know how expensive that can be. Weighing cost vs nutrition, Taste of the Wild seems to be the best value we can find for a grain-free food. Our two greyhounds are 11 and 14, so it hasn't harmed them yet, and may be the reason for their long life.
customer_reviews.author: Glen B

customer_reviews.title: Good dog food
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this food and they can be very picky about the food they like. I knew it was right for them when they ran up to the bag and all three began sniffing it. Once I opened it, our great dane did a happy dance waiting for it to be poured into his bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Cakesaurus

customer_reviews.title: And the dogs love it! It's small enough kibble that my yorkies ...
customer_reviews.text: My mastiff has such a sensitive stomach. I went through several fog foods before reading about this on a forum. I decided to give it a try. It changed things right away. He no longer had the runny poo, but was now normal. And the dogs love it! It's small enough kibble that my yorkies can eat it too. It's also an all life stage, so I won't have to worry about changing later.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Balistreri

product_meta.title: Taste of The Wild Grain Free High Protein Dry Dog Food Wetlands - Roasted Duck
product_meta.description: Size:30lb - DiscontinuedModern science proves that your dog shares the DNA of the wolf. Years of domestication and excellent care have turned your dog from a short-lived potential foe to a long-lived best friend. Although their DNA remains the same and their tastes demand something of the wild, their diet should provide them with all the proper ingredients and nutrition they need to thrive. A grain-free formula with sweet potatoes and peas provides highly digestible energy for your active dog. Made with real roasted and smoked fowl, this formula offers a taste sensation like no other. Supplemented with vegetables and fruits, this hearty formula delivers antioxidants to help give your friend a healthy lifestyle. Your dog craves a taste of the wild. Go ahead and give them one.
feature_bullets: A taste of the wild with ROASTED QUAIL; REAL DUCK is the #1 ingredient; optimal amino acid profile, protein rich for LEAN, STRONG MUSCLES
High protein ingredients with added vitamins & minerals; fruits and vegetables as SUPERFOODS for hard-working ANTIOXIDANTS; fatty acid blend for SKIN & COAT
Ingredients From Trusted, Sustainable Sources Around The World; Made With No Grain, Corn, Wheat, Filler; No Artificial Flavors, Colors, Preservatives Added
Nutrient rich and HIGHLY DIGESTIBLE with guaranteed species-specific, PROPRIETARY PROBIOTICS that survive and thrive in the GI tract
MADE in the USA; FAMILY OWNED & run; food made with scientifically advanced food safety protocols; We'd appreciate your CALL 800.342.4808
